comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Picture of two highly decorated and distinctively marked US Navy Douglas F4D-1 Skyray in formation for a photo-shoot. Both belonged to VM(AW)-3 with squadron tail code AP and 'Modex' nose codes 17 & 12. Both aircraft display the ‘last four’ of their Navy Bureau serial numbers on lower rudders with full serial and type stencilled on upper rear fuselage. 17 is ‘4839’ 12 is ‘9097’ They are respectively F4D-1 Bu No 134839 and F4D-1 Bu No 139097. Another picture on ‘flickr’ of both the same aircraft facing the opposite direction may also be viewed here, obviously from a sequence: www.flickr.com/photos/my_public_domain_photos/4629797004/ Here’s another copy of the above ‘flickr’ pic with 17 and 12: stellar-views.com/images/F-4D_Flt-2_VFAW.jpg They both carry 300-gallon auxiliary fuel tanks below wings. Are armed with AIM-9B Sidewinder infra red guided missiles and the outer pylons carry small pods of rockets to intercept and shoot down enemy nuclear armed bombers. There is also just discernable an under fuselage white centerline pod containing an “electronics package”. VFAW-3 was a land based interceptor squadron attached to NORAD (North American Air Defense Command) and was stationed at NAS North Island, California, USA.
